snippet: The owner of Julius’ in the West Village, one of the longest-running gay bars in the city, hoped to reopen soon after being closed by the health department.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column on the closing of Julius', a Greenwich Village bar that was ordered closed by the Health Dept; says shutdown, even if temporary, is a new wrinkle in part of the city's social history, as Julius' is one of the longest-running gay bars in the city, a regular stop not only for locals but for people visiting historic spots in the Village.
lead_paragraph: The owner of Julius’ in the West Village, one of the longest-running gay bars in the city, hoped to reopen soon after being closed by the health department.

headline.seo: New Wrinkle for a Fixture of Gay Life
headline.main: New Wrinkle for a Fixture of Gay Life
headline.print_headline: New Wrinkle For a Fixture Of Gay Life
